result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Colton W. Dettman

defendant.name: Dettman, Colton W.
defendant.address: 196 S. Main St, Gays Mills, wi 54631

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
10:35 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Colton W. Dettman appeared by video.  Attorney Ryan Kieler appeared by video for Colton W. Dettman.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Kieler is heard and they're ready to proceed with the preliminary hearing in 22CF154. 

1W - Deputy M. Ploessl, sworn
Exam by Attorney Steiner 
Cross by Attorney Kieler 

State requests matter to be bound over for further proceedings. Attorney Kieler objects to bind over. Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for further proceedings.  
Attorney Kieler is heard and they're prepared to go ahead with the arraignment today. 

22FO72 and 22TR455 
Court is heard on the two Forfeiture matters that have appeared back on the calendar with the criminal cases, 22FO72 and 22TR455 which were defaulted on 6/20/2022.  
Attorney Steiner is heard and has nothing in notes as to why the traffic matters were following along. 
Court makes a finding that these two defaulted cases will no longer ride along with the criminal cases as they were properly disposed of back in June. 
Court advises right to reopen if defendant would choose to do so.  No comment by defendant. 

22CF154 - waives reading of the information. Defendant plead not guilty. Clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count. 
22CF102 - waives reading of the information. Defendant plead not guilty. Clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count. 
22CM30 - Defendant plead not guilty. Clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count.
Jury status hearing scheduled for January 5, 2023 at 09:15 am.
C.O.C. ltr. RE: failure to make crt. apptd. atty. payments.  nad

10:01 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Colton W. Dettman in court.  Attorney Ryan Kieler appeared by video for Colton W. Dettman.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

State calls first witness. 

1W - Investigator J. Breeser, sworn 
Exam by Attorney Steiner 
Cross by Attorney Kieler

State requests matter to be bound over for further proceedings. Attorney Kieler objects and withholds argument. Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for further proceedings. 
Attorney Kieler would like another date for the arraignment.
Arraignment scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Arraignment on November 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:40 PM Case called - 22CM30 & 22CF102 appearances stated. (22FO72 & 22TR455 riding along)

Defendant Colton W Dettman appeared by video.  Attorney Ryan Kieler appeared by video for Colton W Dettman.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Court states the Felony case needs to be set for preliminary hearing - suggests we have the CM, TR & FO cases continue to ride along
Counsel agree to have other cases continue to ride along

Court schedules preliminary hearing
Counsel agree to conduct preliminary hearing by zoom

ADDRESS INFO for Colton W. Dettman
Current: 196 S. Main St, Gays Mills, wi 54631   (Effective: 07-08-2022)
Prior: 196 S. Main St, Gays Mills, IA 54631
on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney - Court appoints Atty. Ryan Kieler
Adjourned initial appearance on October 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

3:23 PM Cases 22CM30, 22CF102 called - appearances stated. (22FO72 & 22TR455 continue to ride along, but not called)
Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Colton W Dettman in court. 

Court states Def. only filed a petition in the felony case, questions whether he wishes to have an attorney on both criminal cases.  Def. states he does.  Court advises def. he is not entitled to court appointed attorney on the traffic matters
Court reviews court appointed attorney paperwork with  def.  Court approves Petition for Ct. Appointed attorney, and will appoint an attorney for both 22CM30 and 22CF102
Def. to pay $50.00 bi/wkly com immediately.

Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

     Def. states no atty. yet.
     Court concludes at 1:35 p.m.

Adjourned initial appearance on August 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw.

9:35 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Colton W. Dettman in court, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

22CF100 and 22CF102 called together 

22CF102 - Initial Appearance Hearing

9:37 AM Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained. 

State is heard on bond. State requests a Signature bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Court orders a $1,000.00 signature bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw.

Court advices right to counsel.


22CF100 - Extradition Hearing 

9:41 AM Court provides defendant with a copy of the warrant and a waiver of extradition form. 

Court reviews waiver of extradition form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Defendant agrees to waiver of extradition. Defendant initialed each paragraph.

Defendant signs waiver of extradition. 
Court finds defendants waiver of extradition has been made freely, knowingly and voluntarily. 

Court signs waiver and provides a copy to the defendant. Sheriffs department will contact Clayton County Iowa to make arrangements. 
Defendant is heard.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
